data.title: The Chronicle
data.meta_description: The Chronicle is Duke University's independent student news organization where you can find campus news, Blue Devil sports coverage, features, opinion and breaking news.
data.text:
Articles

OPINION | LETTERS TO THE EDITOR

Response to “Add LGBTQ identity question to college application”

In Monday’s guest column, Daniel Kort suggests that an optional LGBTQ identity question be added to next year's undergraduate application.

NEWS | UNIVERSITY

Fight against Vandalism: Voice from Action

NEWS | UNIVERSITY

Duke Engage: Partial justice does have merits

NEWS | UNIVERSITY

Robertson interconnects wealth and social capital

The meaning of wealth depends on how it is expended, said Julian Robertson, philanthropist and billionaire investor.

NEWS

New Duke Medicine partnership promotes local health education

A community health program launched by DUMC is connecting Duke students with the Durham community in order to enrich both.

NEWS | HEALTH & SCIENCE

Scientists prove ability to split charge of electron

A recent simulation by a group of physicists has proved that it is possible to split the charge of an electron in half.

NEWS | UNIVERSITY

Former Clinton admin discusses US-India relations

The United States needs to put more emphasis on economic engagement in order to enhance its relationship with India, a former Clinton administration official said.

NEWS | HEALTH & SCIENCE

Deshusses given $100K grant for waste disposal system

A Duke environmental engineer will apply a recently received grant to safely eliminate biowaste in underdeveloped countries.

NEWS | UNIVERSITY

Kilner explains the overlooked beauty of war

War can be beautiful, a U.S. Army officer said Friday.

NEWS | UNIVERSITY

Expert debates possible water policies

The United States needs to adopt an integrated water policy in order to confront the long-term water crisis, a leader in water sustainability said Monday.
